titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Emperor Nicholas II miscellaneous papers
Nicholas II, Emperor of Russia miscellaneous papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-01-18T10:57-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Revised to change box 3 to a map case folder after preservation work.

physdesc.extent: 1 manuscript box, 1 oversize box, 1 oversize folder

did.abstract: Two imperial orders (printed) signed by Nicholas II, 1905 and 1908; letters (handwritten and typewritten copies) from Nicholas II to Prime Minister P. A. Stolypin, 1906-1911; facsimiles of the abdication documents of Nicholas II and Grand Duke Mikhail, 1917; Nicholas II's diary (handwritten copy); two religious books belonging to the Romanov family, which were found in Ekaterinburg after their murder; and other materials relating to the reign of Nicholas II. Includes a colored reproduction of a painting of Nicholas II.

origination.label: Contributor
origination.persname: Mikhail Aleksandrovich, Grand Duke of Russia, 1878-1918.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Emperor Nicholas II miscellaneous papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Two imperial orders (printed) signed by Nicholas II, 1905 and 1908; letters (handwritten and typewritten copies) from Nicholas II to Prime Minister P. A. Stolypin, 1906-1911; facsimiles of the abdication documents of Nicholas II and Grand Duke Mikhail, 1917; Nicholas II's diary (handwritten copy); two religious books belonging to the Romanov family, which were found in Ekaterinburg after their murder; and other materials relating to the reign of Nicholas II. Includes a colored reproduction of a painting of Nicholas II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two copies of a bound volume of letters (typewritten and handwritten copies) from Nicholas II to Prime Minister P. A. Stolypin, translated from Russian into English.

did.unittitle: Five photographs (prints) of Nicholas II and relatives,
Bound volume of imperial orders signed by Nicholas II,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pages from a handwritten copy of the diary of Nicholas II. The handwriting indicates that the copy was made by several different individuals.

did.unittitle: "Prisiaga. Kliatvennoe Obeshchanie na Vernost' Sluzhby" ("An Oath of Loyal Service"),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes facsimiles of the Acts of Abdication of Nicholas II and his brother Mikhail (with typewritten English translations), among other material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes dried flowers, a feather, and what appears to be a cloth bookmark, presumably taken from within the pages of the religious books.

did.unittitle: Colored reproduction of a 1911 painting of Nicholas II,
